data.title: Voxel refactoring

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body:
This changes the voxel renderer to draw via a framebuffer into a texture, which are composited with the world as sprites. This removes all of the stencil/depth buffer clears and allows shadows to done without a special shader.

Summary of important changes:
- Adds FBO / render-to-texture support to Graphics.SdlCommon (minspec now requires GL_ARB_framebuffer_object).
- Allows texture data to be read back from the GPU.
- Adds a geometry visualization debug layer.
- Supports sprites with a built-in render offset (implements half of #3287).
- Removes nearest-pixel position rounding from SpriteRenderer - things that need this have plenty of opportunity to round themselves beforehand.
- Introduces a BeforeRender method on IRenderable.
- Exposes alpha blending to renderer code (was previously hardcoded on).
- Removes stencil buffer support.
- Other refactoring to support the above.

A future patch will be able to cache sprites based on the input arguments to give a serious perf win for large groups of units, but that can wait until we actually need it.

Screenshot of the geometry visualization:
![renderdebug](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/657828/439c51e4-d58f-11e2-8ed1-6975c8f299a5.png)

data.title: NRE in Game.JoinExternalGame()
data.body:
Setting a blank `ConnectTo:` in settings.yaml NREs at Game.cs:L464.

JoinExternalGame() is pretty sketchy in general - it is hacked in via the loadscreen and abuses the settings code when it should be checking the commandline arguments directly.

It also doesn't seem to work at all - setting Game.ConnectTo in the commandline args takes me to the shellmap instead of connecting to the requested server.

This fixes:

data.title: dont allow client to force their own admin flag on

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.title: No option to change mod
data.body:
Attempted to install d2k mod.
Presented with dialog box with multiple options: "Extract Data", "Download", "Copy Music", "Exit". Neither Extract Data nor Download works at setting up the mod properly, as happened to me (This was partially expected; I didn't have Dune2000 installed. As for Download, OpenRA kept crashing once the download was complete).

The real problem is this: once you get to this screen, there is no option to switch back to another mod that does work. Quitting and restarting only brings me back to the same screen. I can't find a config file to edit that will let me start up OpenRA anywhere but the same screen. Worse, the problem persists even upon uninstalling and reinstalling.

data.title: Fixed CS1701 xbuild/md-tool warning
data.body: As we enforce a strict no compiler warnings policy it is annoying and irritating that MonoDevelop always displays this one. Fixed it so new real warnings do not get overlooked.

Target generations
data.body: This series reworks how we invalidate targets on ownership change, and adds new invalidation when the targeted unit is chronoshifted.

data.title: Civilians will panic when running over heal crates

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body: Found it out while testing Fort LoneStar #3379 and collecting some crates to see what is in them. They had full health.

data.title: Fixes Issue #2205 (turret A can hit turret B but not vice-versa)
data.body:
Fixes issue #2205 that if two turrets/units with the same weapon range are placed at the edge of their range, from certain angles one can hit the other but not vice-versa.

It's quite possible this just works around a deeper-rooted Actor-related issue.

data.title: Faster edge scroll speed & static mouse for middle mouse scrolling
data.body:
make a wider range for the edge scroll so u can edge scroll faster than currently possible.

Maybe make the mouse static when holding mid mouse so u wont have to do a 2 motion to make 1 scroll.

data.title: Infiltration code cleanup
Improve and enforce OnRails
data.body:
Units with OnRails (originally from Mobile) set should ignore orders from players, and be assumed to be following some terminating sequence of activities such as paradropping, parabombing, a-10 airstrike etc. This should fix some gameplay exploit problems.

data.title: Production queue - change BuildTimeSpeedUpDivisor
data.body:
This is needed. The current integer parameter was limited - we could never have less than a 50% build speed reduction.

I `grep`ed for mods using this yaml setting and found none.

**Note: This does not enable it for any mods**
- Now is a yaml setting where you can set the decay in %, e.g. 100, 85, 75, 65, etc. So the second production building reduces time to 85% of original time, third 75% of original time, etc.

data.title: Capture changes - Engis now capture from outside. Added classic (legacy)...
data.body:
... capturable traits.

Changes made are:
- Capture classes no longer require the Building trait.
- Removed "change owner to neutral" when capturing, and split the current Capturable logic into two pieces: Capturable and LegacyCapturable.
- RA Engineers use Capturable (RA Sniper uses LegacyCapturable on Church)
- Cnc Engineers use LegacyCapturable

Capturable
- Engineers take 15 seconds to capture buildings, and do so from the outside. Engi and the building will flash while capturing, and the progress bar is shown.

LegacyCapturable
- Engineers will sabotage or enter a building, if it has low enough health, to capture it
- In Cnc, sending two engineers to one building will result in the building being dropped to 50% health, then captured. Neutral buildings require no sabotage (ever).

YAML (Capturable)
- Capture duration (attached to building)
- Destroy engi after cap (attached to engi)

YAML (LegacyCapturable)
- Capture HP threshold (attached to building)
- Sabotage damage (attached to engi)

YAML (Both)
- Capture types=building,vehicle,etc
- AllowAllies/AllowNeutral/AllowEnemies

data.title: Added support for WAVE sound files
data.body: This adds `.WAV` file support to `OpenRA.FileFormats` as promised in #2174. I tested it with an unconverted Dune 2000 `BUILD1.WAV` extracted using @mvi's [Sound Effect Tool](http://d2kplus.com/soundeffecttool.php). I will add support for [SOUND.RS](http://d2kplus.com/wiki/index.php?title=SOUND.RS) later so we can get rid of those non-free `mods/d2k/bits/*.aud` binaries in our SCM and release packages completely.

data.title: Spurious MultiTapDetection events
data.body:
The multi-tap detection only seems to care about time, and not any other keypresses.
Quickly pressing a-b-a or similar combinations will fire a with a multi-tap count of 2.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/407733-spurious-multitapdetection-events?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>
